column2: A Buddhist, Hindu or Muslim shall, having stated so, and prior to narrating the facts
contained therein, solemnly and sincerely affirm to the truthfulness of such facts;
Such  oath  or  affirmation  shall  be  taken  before  a  Justice  of  the  Peace  or  a
Commissioner for Oaths [collectively referred to as Justice of the Peace];
The affidavit shall be signed by the declarant in the presence of the Justice of the
Peace before whom the oath or affirmation is made;
The  jurat  shall  state  the  time  and  the  place  at  which  the  affidavit  was  sworn  or
The Justice of the Peace shall thereafter cancel the stamp and place his signature
and seal on the affidavit in the presence of the declarant.
